imageDimensions.summary: All images are high-resolution scans of book spreads (two pages)
imageDimensions.note: Aspect ratio ~1.2 indicates landscape scans of book spreads (left+right pages)

centerRegionAnalysis.purpose: Find book gutter/spine for split detection
centerRegionAnalysis.keyFinding: UNEXPECTED PATTERN - No traditional center gutter detected

brightnessProfile.description: P10 values indicate the 10th percentile brightness (darker = lower value)

invertedGutterPattern.description: CENTER IS LIGHTER THAN EDGES - opposite of typical book scans
invertedGutterPattern.interpretation: The 49-54% region is significantly BRIGHTER (higher P10) than edges. This suggests the book binding creates a shadow at the TEXT EDGES rather than at the center spine.

textBlockPattern.description: Dark regions at 40-48% and 55-60% correspond to text blocks on each page
textBlockPattern.centerGap: 49-54% - this is the exposed paper between page text blocks

variablePositioning.description: Darkest column position varies significantly between pages (48-55%)
variablePositioning.cause: Text density varies per page; the darkest column follows where text is densest
variablePositioning.implication: Split detection should NOT rely solely on darkest column

splitDetectionStrategy.approach: Use BRIGHTEST region in center, not darkest
splitDetectionStrategy.reason: This book's scans show the gutter/gap as a LIGHT strip around 49-52% width
splitDetectionStrategy.metric: Find column with HIGHEST P10 or average brightness

alternativeApproach.reason: The transition from text to margin creates vertical edges that may be more reliable

robustApproach.method: Use aspect ratio to confirm two-page spread, then split at 50%
robustApproach.reason: All pages have aspect ratio ~1.2, strongly suggesting landscape spread
robustApproach.threshold: If aspectRatio > 1.1, assume two-page spread and split at center
